literals: "Computes the contour meshes for the iso-values in the scalar field defined by the mesh and the values. \n"
"The values are assumed to change linearly between vertices."
"Mesh which defines the positions of the values in the scalar field."
"Value for of scalar field for each vertex in the mesh."
"Values in the scalar field to produce the iso-meshes for."
"Meshes on the iso-values of the scalar field defined by the mesh and values."
"Number of vertexValues must match the number of vertices in the mesh."
comments: SubMesh works on regular meshes, and since we're looking at it one cell at a time, the extra information in the mesh3d is not needed
Create a mesh from the cell
Find the iso lines for the boundary of the cell
Note that each vertex may be added twice here from neighboring cells
A rough triangulation of the imagined face covering the polyline, (assumes convex polyline)
